name: Iberostar Tucan Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I just got back from our stay at the Iberostar Tucan. First off, I am comparing this one mainly on other resorts I have stayed at.
reviews.title: fabulous (but busy) resort

likes.liked: — food, overall quality of resort, staff

reviews.text: Resort layout and first coming:
reviews.title: Perfect Wedding

reviews.text: The resort is rather large. It has a string of buildings with multiple floors of rooms. There is a large buffet restaurant and I believe five different a la carte restaurants (Italian, Mexican, Japanese, Steak, and Caribbean). There is one large pool then a small kiddie pool and an adult only pool (with a swim up bar). The beach seems to be back to "normal" from when the hurricane came, but it is obvious that the beach that is not behind a sand bag is eroding. The path to the beach is stone and through a jungle. The staff was very friendly and even brough us drinks when we first arrived.
reviews.title: 7 days at Tucan...and it was "OK".

likes.disliked: — nothing other than the staff/food was all that impressive

reviews.text: Room:
reviews.title: Wonderful Vacation!

likes.liked: — Very clean, spacious, excellent service, amazing beach area
likes.disliked: — no complaints; maybe slightly more variety at dinner buffet

reviews.text: The room was average in my opinion. We had two double beds and a decent size bathroom (very large shower). The beds were very hard, but I prefer a hard bed so I slept perfectly fine. I loved the animals the maids created out of towels. Every day there was a different animal. We were at the farthest building from the beach, but it still was not too far of a walk.
reviews.title: Most Amazing Wedding & fabulous resort

likes.liked: — amazing beach and extremely clear water, great pool, wonderful staff, the best weddding I could have imagined

reviews.text: I wanted to write a review since I found the tripadvisor reviews so helpful. I travelled with my husband and 2 kids, ages 4 and 1 and stayed at Iberostar Tucan for 4 nights between Nov and Dec 2008.
reviews.title: My 4 year old loved it...

likes.liked: — the rooms, travertine tiles, bathrooms, the jungle animals, warm beach
likes.disliked: — cold adult pool, food not available 24 hours/day, exposing kids to PG rated entertainment

reviews.text: Firstly, I read a few message strings on the Iberostar-board.com website, and after figuring out how to navigate the site, discovered a few helpful things, primarily the hotel’s e-mail to request a room, room recommendations, and found out that the standard room’s pull-out sofa was just a daybed and the bathroom only had a stand-up shower. So I requested a third floor, non-smoking room with a king size bed that faced the jungle in Bldg 13. I also brought along an inflatable bath for my 1 year old.
reviews.title: honeymoon/bridesmaid @ wedding

reviews.text: I was told once I got to the hotel that only Bldgs 15,16 and 17 were non-smoking and that Bldgs 14, 13 12 were smoking. I got a second floor room facing the jungle in Bldg 15 which worked out fine. It was closer to the breakfast restaurant and we only had 2 flights of stairs to climb. I was able to see lots of monkeys up close at around 7AM from the roof of bldg 13. It was a wonderful experience to see the monkeys, including a cute baby, dining on leaves at the top of the tree. I found the bed too hard, but I was the only one complaining. The room was very nice, modernly designed and clean. The shower had enough room for the 4 of us. I thought though an extra shower head would have been perfect. The floor was hard (maybe travertine tiles) so we made sure the kids were dry before leaving the bathroom and placed towels from the towel art on the floor as makeshift rugs.
reviews.title: Great time at the Iberostar

reviews.text: I booked through unitedvacations.com which seemed just like funjet.com (and cost the same) but it allowed me to book at Tucan instead of Quetzal. One side note, the Lomas Travel van was a luxury van so it was quite comfortable. My only beef was that they played the same DVDs over and over again, one describing the attractions in the Playa/Cancun area and the other was of oldies-but-goodies with the Bee-Gees, Roy Orbison, Elvis etc. Despite the cervezas offered, the DVDs just spoiled the energy and vibe. I am from Jamaica originally and visit often, and there is a wonderful vibe and energy I feel once I arrive.
reviews.title: Beautiful wedding and vacation at the Tucan

reviews.text: In case you’re wondering, there is no difference between the Tucan and Quetzal hotels (room-wise and facility-access-wise). I didn't have too much time to walk on the Quetzal side due to the kids, but I found their jungle path a little more interesting and they had tortoises, swans, ducks and, it appeared that day, more monkeys to see. The hotel grounds were like a zoo or jungle, which helped escape any form of boredom during the entire 4 days we were there.
reviews.title: Always a good time at Iberostar

likes.liked: — Great service, great food, great locale

reviews.title: good and bad
reviews.text: We stayed at the Iberostar Tucan on Jan. 4 Thru Jan. 12, 2008. The property is lovely, The staff helpful and couteous, The food average. NOW to the beach it does not exist. The erosion has taken so much that the palm trees are falling into the ocean, electrical wires exposed and looks to be threatening the buildings at the sister hotel next door. If you want to stay at a resort with a beach this is NOT it.

We just arrived home a few days ago from our stay 01/05/08 to 01/12/08. this was our first trip with our two girls 7 and 19 months. we have been to plenty of iberostars and rius in the past without the girls and decided we'd go back to mexico because we loved the beaches last time. we got there at 10am and like we expected were not able to get a room until around 3 which was kinda a pain but we were expecting it. while we were waiting we walked around and checked everything out which was very nice. we LOVED the jungle and all the animals were great to see. the pool was pretty but jammed packed, and for those who have young kids that arent strong swimmers this pool really isnt for them. there are two entranced that are walk in areas like a beach type thing but there are so many people crammed in this areas and around 12 they play the pool games which can get rowdy for little ones to play around.also once you enter the pool its 5ft deep. in my opinion to deep for us. after checking out the pool we ventured over to the beach and were upset to see once you walked through the jungle of chairs crowded together you came upon a cliff of sand about 8-10 feet high. to get down is tough with kids and even without them its tricky. the shore is lines with fallen huts and dead palm trees which roots stick out of the cliff of sand. I'm not trying to be negative, it was nice but not what we payed for and def. not safe for children to play around. the staff and rooms were good. the food was ok but we were'nt expecting 5 star food. the buffet has plenty of things to choose from, alot of staple food everyone likes like fries,chips,pizza,hamburgers, salad and lots more.the resturants were good, not the best ones but still good. though id skip the tropical which was not so great, in my opinion that is.we got a babysitter during one afternoon. from 1pm-4pm. they were wonderful with our children and they enjoyed themselves as did we for a couple of hours. we went scuba diving to baracuda reef and that was awesome, we was alot of fish,even a stingray.while the kids were with the the sitters we took a walk on the beach.this was the last day of our vacation and the hotel seems to start trying to save what was left of the beach with huge sandbags. at the time we left they had almost half the beach with sandbags in front of it. it just helped stop more eriosion. didnt do anything for the already ruined beach. we walked in front of the riu and wished we stayed there. they had a beach problem too but seemed to be working on the problem much better and faster. they had actually made stairs with small sandbags to get down and had grated some sand out and made more of a beach with no debris in it.. the beach even had chairs on it!
reviews.title: The truth about iberostar tucan

likes.liked: — the staff were really good for the most part, the resort just had some flaws i couldnt over look

reviews.title: Iberostar Tucan.
reviews.text: overall besides the beach the hotel was good but i dont think its like the other iberostars we've stayed at. it just didnt have the same class. if you are looking forward to the beach you will be very upset, if you are looking forward to the pool, you better get use to getting up at 4am to get a seat, not even a good one. im not kidding. because in my opinion the beach was unsafe for my family we hung around the pool most vacation and had to get up and "reserve" chairs. i had to go around 6am and about 90% of the seats were taken. i dont agree in reserving chairs but the fact is in this hotel you have too to get a seat at all. though we were out on the chairs around 7, compared to some who didnt arrived to there chairs till 1pm which was annoying.

if anyone find out they dont want to say here and have already booked see if you can change it and if not once you get there you can ask the hotel to switch you to the other iberostars down the street. its worth it! we would have but found out the 2nd to last day we were there we could do this. we've stayed at the delmar , its amazing! we also met a family who stayed there the same week we did and showed us pictures of the beach and it was great, not any major erosion like tucan. please enjoy yourselves and dont let my review et you upset. just know what to expect and make the best of what you can if its too late to change anything.
reviews.title: Iberostar Tucan is great

likes.liked: — very tropical atmosphere, the groungs were beautiful

reviews.text: i will download pictures later or email me for them
reviews.title: Wish we were still at the Tucan

likes.liked: — The jungle setting and close to Playa Del Carmen

reviews.title: Beat our expectations!
reviews.text: I read many reviews before booking this trip and therefore had some specific expectations:

reviews.title: once again this place was great
reviews.text: 1. The rooms would be outdated: We had oceanfront suite, and the rooms were on the older side, but the bathroom looked recently renovated.

reviews.title: resort was good not much more then that
reviews.text: 2. The rooms would be dirty: Our room was not spotless. I asked that it be cleaned again on arrival and a few times again after the maid was done, but they cleaned up quickly, and their attitude was great - therefore this was not a negative.

reviews.title: Gorgeous Grounds with Jungle Atmosphere-Great Time!
reviews.text: 3. The food would be terrible - since I was with two small kids and a very picky husband, I was really worried about this one. We were pleasantly surprised by the varied selection. Grilled chicken and fish were tender, moist and tasty, fresh quacamole, salads, rice, etc, my kids were very satisfied. My husband was too! This was a huge improvement to Beaches, where the kids menu consisted of chicken nuggets and fries. I was initially upset that we were only "allowed" 3 specialty restaurants, but it turned out to be more than enough and we really enjoyed eating at the buffet the other times. For specialty restaurants, it was a little hit and miss - at the steakhouse I had a perfect steak, but the steaks my husband and one of our friends ordered were like rubber. We ate at the Japanese restaurant twice. The first time we had the only female chef, and although her tricks were not mindblowing, the food was good, the second time we got more antics but dry food, so I guess you may have a different view depending on what you want more!

reviews.title: Faultless!!! Great Holidays and will go back!!!
reviews.text: 4. Strong waves and currents: This was partially true. We unfortunately had bad weather for all but 2 days of our stay. When the weather was calm and sunny, the ocean was calm, shallow and great for the kids. In more windy weather, the waves were downright dangerous. We didn't let the kids to go in those days.

The resort has a beautiful grounds, it looks almost as a nature, you have animals walking with you, birds, sounds….But be careful if you are traveling with old family members, all grounds are very rough and forget about shoes with heels, it’s really dangerous there.
reviews.title: Beautiful Grounds

reviews.text: The food: it’s average, it’s not bad, but it’s almost the same every two days. Comparing for example with other resort where we’ve been – Grand Sirenis Riviera Maya, where food I will grade as A +, here I will give just B-….
reviews.title: Nice resort with excellent staff

reviews.text: The beach is beautiful, but very crowded, and people doing the same thing every day, they reserve the seats on the early morning and then you hardly can find the place during the day…
reviews.title: Very nice staff in a resort overloaded with too many guests

reviews.text: The best thing about the resort that it’s located in a walking distance to Playa de Carmen and 10 min drive from huge water park, so if you feel boring in the resort, you can easy enjoyed the real small city with beautiful restaurants (where the food will be much better and not very expensive.
reviews.title: Great family vacation!

reviews.text: About hard beds: they are fine actually, and the problem of sleeping connected not with beds but with very loud doors, people who liked night life coming late and the doors will wake up you several times during the nights. Overall, the resort is nice for the price, and mainly for great animal life inside the resort.
reviews.title: Always as good as we remember.

reviews.text: We happened to spend 3 days in Iberostar Del Mar and then moved to Tucan for 5 days (were originally supposed to stay at Tucan the whole week, but bad travel agent made a mistake)
reviews.title: Would not come back to Tucan

reviews.text: I just posted review for Del Mar, and I must say that Tucan was not much different, maybe its the Iberostar in general.
reviews.title: One of the best!

likes.disliked: — Being on a complex full of hotels.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They make you feel unwelcome, quality is low, feels like they trying to "save" on everything. We were in building 12, 2nd floor. The walls are paper thin, you hear every sound outside (door opens/closes/steps/voices, toilet flashes) I am a very light sleeper, and I was up from every sound. The pool is cold and smells bad. In general, it smells bad everywhere in Tucan. My room was smelly, like some animal died in there. Having a small child made me reluctant to move with all out stuff (and where is guarantee that another room will not smell?), so we had to stay. Hotel doesn't feel very new, feels worn down and not very clean. Rooms are smaller than usual, and beds are too hard and small (we had two full beds) Ocean was not great, those sand bags don't do much for the waves, they just ruin the look of the beach. It was still very wavy on windy days (5 out of 7) and calm on quiet days (but then who needs those sand bags???) Overall, the beach looks ugly with those, like giant bags of garbage blocking the entrance to the ocean (I don't understand how can someone say "those are nice", you must be in love and blind or something...) Food was average, same thing every day for lunch and dinner (there was some good stuff, but always the same) Restaurants were mostly bad. They only give you 2 per room for 5 days and there is no way you can get reservations without giving some extra tip for the girl that books it. Japanese restaurant was not too bad actually, but nothing great for the spoiled foodie like me. Steak house was not good, worse than buffet. Steak house was empty by the way, and its hard to get reservations! They just don't want to serve you...
reviews.title: Just OK

reviews.text: After having bad experience with Mexican and Tropical restaurants in Del Mar, we stayed away from those in Tucan. Jungle is ok, but nothing amazing. We barely saw any monkey; they hide during the day I guess. Thankfully, I didn't see a single cat on the property (in Del Mar, skinny and hungry cats walk in buffet all the time) Don't get me wrong, I love cats (I own one) but I don’t' want them in hotel buffet bagging for food.
reviews.title: Nice place, but read the fine print

reviews.text: As you can tell, I was not impressed with Tucan, and would probably not move from Del Mar if I knew that its very similar, just smaller and older (feels older) We were also not very lucky with the weather which contributed to the disappointment. However, I think I don't want to come back to Iberostar resorts anymore and maybe no more Mexico, cause the beaches are consistently bad.
reviews.title: Loved the Tucan - Make Sure the Price is Right

likes.disliked: — Lots of animals roaming around at night

reviews.text: Just completed a one-week stay from Dec 14-21. Let me start by saying most all of the previous reviews are very accurate - believe the hype because this is a great place!
reviews.title: Outstanding Place for Family Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Prior to leaving I emailed the hotel with a room request - and got exactly what we wanted - a 3rd floor room by the beach (it actually had a view of the ocean and pool area) despite full occupancy. Front desk people were very helpful and service-oriented, even towards rude Eastern Europeans.
reviews.title: Nice Resort!

likes.liked: — The beach and the hotel grounds

reviews.text: I will run down our highlights of the resort:
reviews.title: Stunning resort with exceptional value

reviews.text: Service: Probably the best and most efficient we have ever experienced in travelling to all-inclusives for over 20 years. Although they weren't overly "buddy-buddy" friendly, service was very prompt, professional and courteous. We tipped a fair bit, but it did not seem to matter. No matter where you sit, someone will come buy and ask you if you need a drink - awesome!
reviews.title: Enjoyed the Tucan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms: decent size and condition. Minibar stocked every day (Hint: tip chambermaid a couple dollars each day - you will have plenty of towels, bottled water, beer etc). Room blocks in the low 10's and 20's are closer to the beach - we find this reduces the amount of walking even though the resort is not that big.
reviews.title: Great Vacation

likes.liked: — I really liked everything about this trip.

reviews.text: Just got back from a fantastic two week holiday at the Hotel Tucan/Quetzal, just as good as last year.
reviews.title: Just as good the second time around
Paradise!!!
reviews.text: The Star Friends work so hard and such long hours but always have time for you and a smile. (Girls, just take a look at Fabios body, very nice!!!!) The only slight nagative point was that the shows were much the same as last year.

reviews.title: perfect!!!
reviews.text: The cleaning staff are second to none and everything is kept spotlessly clean.

reviews.title: Fantastic hotel u must go
reviews.text: Food very good. We didn't try the Japanese last year but now regret this as we went twice this year, so fresh and was so entertaining to watch it being cooked, also a good way of getting to know other people as tables are for 18 people. Steakhouse & Italian both good but didn't bother with the Mexican as last year felt that the buffet Mexican options were better.
Had to get up early to reserve sunbeds and huts by thebeach but well worth it, so much to watch all day.
reviews.title: Fantastic!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We been in this resort 8 times and everytime we go we have a good time. We have been spoiled by the staff. We are very surprised when people talk bad about this 5 star resort. The food is excellente in all the restaurants and the night entertaiment is good. We never had any complaints about this resort. The is very nice and clean. The location is excellente.
reviews.title: wonderful vacation

reviews.text: Our trip was fantastic. We went with my entire family, so there were 14 of us. We had a toddler, teenagers, younger adults, parents, and grandparents ranging in age from 4-72. It was a perfect stay for us! We stayed in the ocean view junior suites, which I highly recommend. They are bigger rooms and they are right next to the breakfast and lunch buffet as well as the pool and the beach. Best location to stay on the property. It isn't a fancy resort, but it is well maintained and beautiful.
reviews.title: Fabulous Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highlights of the resort:
reviews.title: No Complaints Whatsoever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Excellent staff; especially loved the Star Friends. They were so entertaining and welcoming and always tried to get people to participate in activities and have a good time.
reviews.title: would never go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Food was good, not fantastic. I have no complaints, however. One of my favorite restaurants, was actually the Mexican restaurant. That got a lot of poor reviews on Trip Advisor, but I thought it was good.
reviews.title: fantastic service

reviews.text: Just returned from the iberostar tucan ( May 6-11 )and it was fantastic. This was the second trip to the tucan for my husband and myself , but this time we brought our two sons 11& 16 with us and they loved it as well.
reviews.title: Love the Tucan
Outstanding for Families!!
reviews.text: It is about a 50 min. trip from the airport to the resort. All went very smoothly. We arrived at the tucan about 1p.m. Our room was not ready but we changed into our swim suits had lunch at the buffet and by then our room was ready.

I requested by e-mail to have a room in building 11 or 12 FACING the pool and thats what we got. Our room had two double beds and a small couch big enough for my younger son to sleep on. The weather was beautiful not a drop of rain but it is very hot so plan on it and make sure you lotion covers every inch -you'll get burned in unexpected places feet, inner arms etc.
reviews.title: positives and negatives

reviews.text: Bring floats from home they will blow them up for free . They are expensive in the gift shop and you won't want to bring them home with you.
reviews.title: Am sure you will enjoy
Great Place!!!
reviews.text: Food is good- make reservations right away and also get on a waiting list.

reviews.title: Wish we were still there
reviews.text: We really appreciated all the information people gave on this hotel, so we feel obliged to give our own review and add whatever helpful hints we can for this hotel. We gave it an above average rating rather than excellent although it is really somewhere between the two.

reviews.title: Awesome hotel
reviews.text: Who we are: A married couple celebrating our 3 year anniversary. Both professionals in our late twenties/mid thirties. We love to travel and enjoy staying at big resorts with lots of amenities. We have traveled to Puerto Vallarta and Hawaii together as well as other destinations and stayed at a spectrum of resorts over the last 5 years.

reviews.title: AN ABSOULUTELY AMAZING HOTEL!
reviews.text: Overview: This is an enormous resort located in a gated resort community called Playacar. To reiterate what others on this site have said, this is one giant hotel, with a jungle (complete with animals!) & giant lake size pool running down the middle. We are not sure why they have two sides (Tucan/Quetzal) when its essentially one hotel. There are 700 rooms. It was much bigger with a lot more people than we imagined. We stayed there Tues April 25-Sun April 30. We truly enjoyed our stay. The resort is very well maintained and has every thing you need right there. You really do not have to leave to have a great vacation!

reviews.title: Great Place
reviews.text: Booking the room: You cannot book on the Iberostar website. You have to go through a travel agency. Funjet had the best prices. We went through our local American Express Travel office for the room and transfers. We booked our own airfare on Continental.

reviews.title: Been to better
reviews.text: Getting there: We live in Houston, TX so for us its an 1:50 minute flight to Cancun. From Cancun aiport to the Iberostar is a 45 minute drive by car. You could take a taxi for around $40 (US) or book the transfer through your agent.

We had our Wedding at Iberostar Tucan and had the best time ever! There was a group of about 30 of us and everyone loved the hotel. The grounds are beautiful with little paths through the jungle and alot of animals to see. Just be sure to bring walking shoes or flats. No heels because the property is very large and there is a lot of walking around to get places. On the paths, you will see Monkeys, many kinds of birds, turtles,etc.
reviews.title: Best Vacation Ever
paradise in mexico simply the best
reviews.text: The pools are fabulous & the beach is stunning with soft white sand and warm turquoise water. The beach is also not too crowded, but there are quite a few topless woman -so be aware if that bothers you.
The staff is very nice, and the maids are so sweet- making little animals out of the towels. My only complaint is that the beds are as hard as a rock!- No kidding!!! The rooms are simple and clean.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From our balcony, we watched groups of monkeys swing on the trees. A mother and baby monkey would come on our balcony every morning and knock on our sliding door because we had a fruit bowl on our table. It was so cute!
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food and drinks were quite good. The buffets have alot of different options, and you also can go to ala carte restaurants. Just be sure to make your dinner reservations when you get there, because they go fast!
reviews.title: Faulty towers

reviews.text: Beware if you have or are a young adult...the hotel staff seem to be out to get this age group. Also beware that if any of these staff threaten to call the mexican police for any kind of offense--no matter how small and insignificant, you will be powerless to do anything because they can just make up a serious charge. We had this happen on our 2nd trip to the Iberostar Tucan, but this occurrence happened in the Quetzal lobby. The lobby clerk physically accosted my 22 year old brother who was walking through the lobby on the way back to his room for the night, and who jokingly tried to move around some signs on the way. He was not belligerent and was immediately apologetic but the clerk was ruthless. He said he was calling the police and it became a huge scene in the middle of the night. The next day, a public relations staff member called the next day saying my brother had been accused of urinating in public, which everyone, including the hotel clerk and the 3 security guards he called, knew was a blatant lie. The staff was not friendly nor helpful in trying to resolve this issue in the following days. Also, DO not ask for run of the house, because in a resort with thousands of rooms and views, you will get a room with a balcony facing the road outside the resort.
reviews.title: Brutal, uncalled for treatment by lobby staff and worst room in the resort

reviews.text: We just got back a couple weeks ago from the Tucan.... very nice resort... very clean... beautiful location.. loved the jungle.. entertainment just ok.. food is boring after awhile like most reviews state... lunch is the same everyday... so food would be average.. no one in our family got sick... friendy staff..drinks are watered down... saw them mixing water with the vodka... oh well.. just ask for a double!!!....room are a little dated.. could use flat screen tvs... also the lack of WIFI was a disappointment in the rooms... only have a few channels on tv worth watching... felt extremely safe there.. Playa Del Camen is very nice... also shopping a few blocks down the street from the resort..We have been to the Iberostar Bavaro 5 times in the Dominican Republic... same enertainment.. same food... good value for your money.... Would return.... weather was beautiful.... arounfd 78 every day.. hot sun... nice brezze little chilly at nite... beach is FABULOUS!! they need more beach chairs and pool chairs... none to be found anywhere after 10 am. ( towel game)..pools were cold... all in all a great relaxing vacation... would definitely return... maybe try one of the other Iberostars in Riviera Maya as well.... Enjoy!!!!
reviews.title: Just got back... Would return

reviews.text: Our trip was simply perfect. We used Exeltur transfer from Cancun Airport to the Tucan. They have the best transfer prices that we found. Eddie Clarke (owner) was waiting for us at the airport holding a sign up with our name. Eddie and the drivers were very professional and on time. What I like about Exeltur was that they didn't pick us up 4 hours prior to our departure, which most of transfer companies do and then you sit at the Airport.
reviews.title: Iberostar Tuncan is Fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now on to my review about the Tucan. The resort is Fabulous and the staff is simply awesome. My wife and I traveled with our two boys, 21 and 19. We booked two rooms next to each other. When we arrived we were told that they were over booked didn't have two rooms next to each other as per our request. Before I could say a word, they quickly told us that they gave us a complementary upgrade to the Presidential Suite. The room was unbelievable. Ocean front with a view of Cozumel from our large Balcony. I would guess that the suite was over 1200 square ft.
reviews.title: Iberostar Tucan and trips around the Mayan Riviera

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service was top notch. The staff at the Tucan will work their tails off for you. Room service was good and our house keeper was great. She always kept our refrigerator stocked with beer. I always left a trip for the house keeper as she worked so hard to keep our large room so nice.
reviews.title: Gorgous, relaxing, i want to go back now!

reviews.text: For anyone considering a destination wedding, the Iberostar chain is the way to go. Initially, I had a lot of doubts about whether to do a destination wedding versus having one locally. I had never been to one nor did I personally know anyone who had attended or been involved in one. But after a month of solid research, I decided to take the leap and chose Iberostar. One of the most important factors that makes Iberostar unique from some of the other 5-6 star resorts is that they have a policy of only holding one wedding a day. That is very important to ensure that you get the ceremony and reception location of your choice, the photographers are not rushed, and that you feel special without seeing 5 other brides walking around in their wedding dresses.
reviews.title: Wedding of my dreams at Iberostar Tucan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked my trip through Apple Vacations. Of all the Iberostar resorts, I specifically chose Tucan because: (a) it is a 5 apple versus a 6 apple resort (cheaper) and (b) the fantastic wedding coordinator, Catalina Cortez.
reviews.title: Where's the beach??

reviews.text: (a) if a 5 apple resort is this close to heaven, then a 6 apple resort must be heaven itself! I was impressed as soon as we stepped off the shuttle into the lobby. Beautiful and clean grounds immersed in the jungle, friendly service from the entire staff, delicious food both at the buffets and restaurants, and plenty of things to do at the resort iself. I couple of our guests who had never been to Mexico were hesitant to go but were blown away by this place- they were reluctant to leave and want to go back again. You would be crazy not to love this resort.
reviews.title: An unbiased review of good and bad points for Tucan

reviews.text: (b) when deciding among the 5-apple Iberostar resorts, I e-mailed the various wedding coordinators and was most impressed by Catalina Cortez. Most wedding coordinators can take up to a month to reply to an e-mail, which can be unsettling and nervewracking. Catalina always responds in a timely fashion, usually in 24-48 hours. Her e-mails were always reassuring, she would write "don't worry", and she would respond to each question thoroughly. She very quickly gained my trust.
reviews.title: If you've been to other Iberostars, you may be slightly disappointed

likes.liked: — Lobby area is beautiful and the
likes.disliked: — Small compared to other IB resorts and the beach is very eroded.

reviews.title: Don't book this season!
reviews.text: Originally, my pastor here in Minnesota was planning on performing the ceremony for us, but 3 months before the wedding he encountered some personal family problems that interfered with his travel plans, so I gave Catalina a heads-up about it. About 6 weeks before the wedding, he confirmed that he unfortunately would not be able to make it. No problem, Catalina confirmed the Mexican minister's availability and arranged for him to perform the ceremony instead. He did a lovely job! I never got to actually meet him since he left right after the ceremony and I was distracted, but I really wish I could have- he seemed like a very kind man. He chose very fitting words that were not the typical mundane wedding vows but at the same time had the traditional meaning.
Group of 12 (ages 8-71 years) at the Tucan for one week, then just two of us for the second week ... what more could we ask for!
reviews.title: Good times had by all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes, the beach was eroding, deal with it! The ocean is still there, it's just that Mother Nature is getting her way for now. We were warned of the erosion by our travel agents.
reviews.title: hell in heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool is big enough, and nice enough to handle alot of people. Fairly deep for small children, but great for our young & older swimmers!
reviews.title: Iberostar one of the best !!!

reviews.text: The grounds are beautiful. Please, be careful on the jungle path from the beach up to the marble/wood paths that go to the lobbys of the T/Q, they are rough and uneven. WATCH YOUR STEP!
reviews.title: Great vacation... but too short!

reviews.text: The staff is AMAZING! I have NEVER seen a harder working bunch of folks in my life! Wait staff (especially Aida) and housekeeping (hola Margarita) were very accommodating. Please tip these people ... they deserve it! Take lots of $1 bills, about $100 per week of your stay.
reviews.title: A great vacation in spite...
Absolutely Magnificent
reviews.text: We travelled in a party of 13 to the Tucan as myself and my partner were married there and from the moment we all arrived we were treated like royalty. I definately recommend this hotel to anybody, i cannot beleive anyone could stay here and not find it totally amazing! I also highly recommend anybody who is thinking of getting married in Mexico to pick the Tucan, the wedding co-ordinator Mariela is such a great help before and during your stay and the wedding location is stunning.

reviews.title: mixed reviews
reviews.text: You really cannot appreciate how beautiful this hotel is until you stay here yourself so get it booked as soon as possible, i can't wait to return!!!!!!

reviews.title: Anohter day in paradise
reviews.text: I am sorry to say that my husband and I had mixed reviews. The beach, pool, grounds, and wildlife were fabulous. I never had a problem getting chairs/umbrellas on the beach before 10 am (the pool was a different story). On the other hand the beds were horribly hard, we did not have one decent night's sleep. The food quality was average at best. My husband and I are not picky eaters, however we had higher expectations. Buffets were slightly better than chain buffets we have here in the states. I was sick on two separate occasions (not a drinker). Many cold foods (perishables such as dairy and assorted meats) were served at room temperatures. After the first illness I tried to choose foods that would not bother me. I was unsuccessful. My husband and I will not be returning.

reviews.title: Keeps getting better!
reviews.text: 2nd April 06-16th.Every day we woke up and said, "Another day in paradise".
The hotel is located next to the Riu Yukatan 2nd from the end of a strip of top hotels which all back onto the beach.Two receptions, Tucan & quetzal(ketsal)
reviews.title: What a Wonderful week!!!

description: Privileged situation directly on the beach of Playacar, around 3 km from the town of Playa del Carmen. Specially recommended for honeymooners. Varied, colourful entertainment programme. Large pool area.
